page.title: 09NAILSTONE COLLIERY - TODAY
page.content: Nailstone Colliery is owned by the {National Coal Board}and is situated about one mile from the village. The coal is used in Power Stations and is transported by{overland conveyor}to a large loading hopper in Bagworth, one mile away. The coal required needs to be from 0-25mm in diameter for powdering into a fine dust that will be blown into blast furnaces. During the miners' strike in 1984-5, 850 lorries were needed to transport 80,000 tons of coal each week from Nailstone. Usually a 1,000 ton train can be loaded in 20 minutes. Today jobs at the colliery vary from fitters and electricians to coal suppliers. Today's mine employs the latest video technology. The mines in this area have a limited life and it is likely that miners will have to find future employment in the{Vale of Belvoir.
